Adam Smith

Adam Smith

Founder, Xobni

Adam Smith is the founder of a startup called Xobni. Xobni is the word ‘inbox’ spelled backwards. They make email software that makes it easier for people to manage relationships and find information in their email. Their product has received a lot of attention from the tech community, including people like Bill Gates. If you use Outlook you should give it a spin!

Adam began writing and selling software online in the same year at age thirteen through a company he created called Vira Tech Development.

After graduating from MIT with his bachelors he started a master’s program and later dropped out to start Xobni. Adam ran Xobni as CEO for two years and now is the CTO and a member of it’s technical staff.

He was recently included in the MIT Technology Review’s list of Top 35 Innovators Under 35, and Inc Magazine’s Top 30 Entrepreneurs Under 30.
